 daniel boone october september american pioneer explorer frontiersman whose frontier exploits made first folk heroes united states boone famous exploration settlement commonwealth kentucky beyond western borders settled part thirteen colonies region legally belonged commonwealth virginia american indian tribes time despite resistance american indian tribes shawnee boone blazed wilderness road cumberland appalachian mountains north carolina tennessee kentucky founded village boonesborough kentucky first english-speaking settlements west appalachians century european people migrated following route marked boone boone militia officer revolutionary kentucky fought primarily european settlers british-aided native americans boone captured shawnee warriors adopted tribe later left indians returned boonesborough help defend european settlements boone elected first three terms virginia general assembly revolutionary fought battle blue licks blue lick last battles revolutionary coming lord cornwallis surrendered washington october following boone worked surveyor merchant fell deeply debt failed kentucky land speculation frustrated legal problems resulting land claims boone emigrated eastern missouri spent last decades life boone remains iconic figure american history legend lifetime especially account adventures published making famous america europe death frequently subject heroic tall tales works fiction adventures real legendary influential creating archetypal western hero american folklore american popular culture remembered foremost early frontiersmen epic  elwood haynes april american inventor metallurgist automotive pioneer entrepreneur industrialist invented metal alloys stellite martensitic stainless steel designed earliest automobiles made united states recognized created earliest american design feasible mass production apperson brothers formed first company united states produce automobiles profitably made many advances automotive industry early career serving superintendent companies indiana boom haynes invented several devices important advance natural industry working indiana natural company oversaw construction first long-distance natural pipeline united states connecting chicago trenton field miles away began formulate plans motorized vehicle early successfully road tested first pioneer july years first automobile patented commercial pursuits death january garrard county kentucky created first term named honor early life family james garrard born stafford county virginia january second three children born colonel william mary garrard mother died sometime afterward father married elizabeth moss couple four children william garrard county lieutenant stafford county virtue held rank colonel command county militia garrard family moderately wealthy stafford county courthouse built land childhood james worked father farm educated common schools stafford county studied home acquiring fondness books early life associated hartwood baptist church near fredericksburg virginia december garrard married childhood sweetheart elizabeth mountjoy shortly thereafter sister mary anne married mountjoy brother colonel interest aircraft young institutionalized racism brown able graduate salutatorian high school brown enlisted navy became midshipman year later brown earned pilot wings october amid flurry press coverage subsequently assigned fighter squadron aboard leyte outset korean leyte ordered korean peninsula arriving october brown ensign flew combat missions corsair aircraft came fire crashed remote mountaintop december mission supporting ground troops battle chosin reservoir brown died wounds spite efforts wingman thomas hudner intentionally crashed aircraft attempting rescue later awarded medal
